image.altText: A group of Aboriginal men walk through the town of Alice Springs, one man holding a protest sign.

props.synopsis: The peak body for Indigenous legal services says the prime minister is "missing in action" and should convene a national cabinet meeting over rising Aboriginal incarceration rates and deaths in custody.

title.children: PM accused of being 'missing in action' on Indigenous deaths in custody

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police are investigating after a woman was allegedly woken by a naked man indecently assaulting her in her Parap home.

title.children: Woman woken by naked man allegedly indecently assaulting her in Darwin home

image.altText: A large poster saying 'Justice for Kumanjayi White' laid on the lawn, with other protest posters and people surrounding.

props.synopsis: More than 100 members of Kumanjayi White's family and community have travelled hundreds of kilometres to gather in Alice Springs for the town's third vigil mourning the young Warlpiri man.

title.children: 'We want justice': Alice Springs holds third rally for Kumanjayi White

image.altText: A square blue sign with white and blue checkers that reads 'Police' in the focused background, blurred blue pole in foreground

props.synopsis:
A Northern Territory police officer is in custody after being arrested and charged with two counts of rape over an incident that allegedly occurred while he was off duty last year.

Â

title.children: Investigators charge NT police officer with two counts of rape

image.altText: A police vehicle parked at the Alice Springs Hospital

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police are investigating a man's death after he fell from a window at Alice Springs Hospital last month.

title.children: Police investigate death in care after man falls from hospital window

image.altText: Bottles or canisters labelled as "pepper spray" on a table

props.synopsis: The NT is set to join WA in allowing residents to carry pepper spray, in a trial the government says will improve public safety and give people "lawful tools to protect themselves".

title.children: NT to allow public to carry pepper spray 'to protect themselves'

image.altText: Crew walk away uninjured from spectacular Finke Desert Race crash

props.synopsis: A trophy truck driver and his navigator are "surprisingly well" after becoming airborne before a spectacular, cartwheeling crash during the Finke Desert Race.

title.children: Desert racers unscathed as wild 160kph crash caught on camera

image.altText: Japanese navy boss stands in front of frigate and smiles

props.synopsis: The Mogami-class frigate's arrival in Darwin comes as Japan competes with Germany to secure a $10 billion Australian defence contract.

title.children: Mogami-class frigate docks in Darwin as Japan pushes for $10bn contract

image.altText: Cooper the beaglier by the fire in stanthorpe

props.synopsis: The weather divide between Queensland's north and south sharpens as cold temperatures set in below the Tropic of Capricorn.

title.children: Queensland's great weather divide â warm north versus freezing south

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile wading into a river, with the sandy bank in the background.

props.synopsis: Katter's Australian Party is proposing new legislation that would allow crocodile culls and safari style hunting trips in Queensland. That bill is currently before a parliamentary inquiry.

title.children: Conservationist Bob Irwin labels crocodile culling 'a pointless exercise'

image.altText: Solar panels installed on a roof

props.synopsis: With only about 10 per cent of solar panels recycled, waste is a major issue, with many stockpiled, sent overseas or ending up in landfill.

title.children: Millions of panels dumped amid boost in solar upgrades

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Press Club speech

props.synopsis: A potential in-person meeting between Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and US President Donald Trump is still anticipated, but senior sources told the ABC it was too soon to be "definitive" and there were "lots of moving parts".

title.children: Albanese-Trump meeting in limbo as Israeli cabinet sanctions trigger US rebuke

image.altText: Brittany looks into the camera, as other cameras are pointed at her while she walks along.

props.synopsis: The National Anti-Corruption Commission has investigated corruption claims made regarding a settlement paid by the Commonwealth to former Liberal staffer Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Corruption watchdog clears Brittany Higgins's $2.4 million payout

image.altText: An LA shopping mall burns in a huge orange fire as a shirtless man on a motorbike and an amblance park down the road.

props.synopsis: In 1992 the National Guard was called into Los Angeles to help control widespread, destructive rioting. But right now those forces appear to be escalating the situation and some experts are warning it is all in the name of "political theatre".

title.children: In 1992 'all hell broke loose' in LA, but this time is different

image.altText: Liberal party MP Moira Deeming exits from a joint party meeting, wearing a blue dress.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Independent Broad-based Anti-Corruption Commission has been asked to investigate Moira Deeming's offer to delay bankruptcy proceedings against John Pesutto.

title.children: Moira Deeming referred to corruption investigators over John Pesutto offer

image.altText: Frozen animated characters of a young man and a woman stand next to a snowman and elk.

props.synopsis: Disney and Universal file a copyright infringement lawsuit against an AI firm the Hollywood giants describe as a "bottomless pit of plagiarism".

title.children: Disney and Universal sue AI firm, label it 'bottomless pit of plagiarism'

image.altText: Pump jack

props.synopsis: Oil prices have leapt to two-month highs, with Brent crude up 5 per cent overnight. The energy sector is leading the gains on the ASX 200. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Oil prices leap on Middle East tensions, energy stocks lead ASX

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia reports its highest global ranking in gender equality
US trade conflict with China 'wouldn't be bad', says former White House economist
ASX teeters as energy stocks rally

image.altText: A needle going into a baby's thigh.

props.synopsis: The federal government has revealed plans to tackle declining childhood vaccination rates with the launch of a new immunisation plan.

title.children: New immunisation plan to tackle drop in childhood vaccination rates

image.altText: A man wearing a navy tuxedo and bow tie turns his outstretched palms upwards

props.synopsis: Khaby Lame, the world's most popular TikTok personality, has voluntarily departed the US after he was detained by immigration officers in Las Vegas.

title.children: TikTok star detained in US as pro-Trump influencer boasts of reporting him

image.altText: Two men at press conferences wear suits and stand outside.

props.synopsis:
After a nail-biting few days of "will they, won't they, could they, should they," Tasmania's very, very early election is full steam ahead. And whoever wins on July 19 owes voters a better effort than the last parliament.

Â

title.children: Liberals, Labor hamstrung on key issues in Tasmanian election no-one wanted

image.altText: Sloane Stephens sets up to return a ball with a backhand shot

props.synopsis: Female players who choose to undergo a fertility protection procedure will be allowed to take time away from the sport and return to competitive action with a protected ranking.

title.children: Female tennis players undergoing fertility procedures to get protected ranking

image.altText: A woman in a black silk jacket with the words 'Fight Mum' and 'Che Kenneally' embroidered across the back.

props.synopsis: Che Kenneally should be focusing on next month's world title defence fight. Instead, the single mum is juggling fundraising and working full time for the privilege of stepping into the ring.

title.children: World championship boxer struggles to pay $25k to fight for title

image.altText: Police officers stand in front of a large house

props.synopsis: The bodies of the man and the woman were discovered inside a granny flat in Forestville, following a welfare check by police.

title.children: Couple found dead in Sydney granny flat had lacerations to bodies

image.altText: Joanne Ciconte with the visor on her helmet lifted, looking into the distance

props.synopsis: Joanne Ciconte is the first Australian to score championship points in F1's all-female category, the first of potentially many accolades for the teenager.

title.children: Aussie teen creating history, while settling into life in the fast lane

image.altText: A large blaze burning out of a house, seen behind a group of people walking on the streets.

props.synopsis: Masked rioters attacked police and set homes and cars alight on a second night of widespread civil disobedience in a Northern Irish town.

title.children: How riots erupted in Northern Ireland after an alleged sex assault

image.altText: A man being held on the ground by police with his arms being held behind his back.

props.synopsis: Demonstrations against Immigration and Custom Enforcement actions are planned across the US in coming days as opposition to the Trump administration's immigration raids grows.

title.children: Protests spread to more US cities after Los Angeles unrest

image.altText: A white-haired man wearing a suit looks sideways

props.synopsis: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the bodies of two hostages have been recovered from Gaza, saying "we will not rest and we will not be silent" until all hostages are "brought home".

title.children: Israel says bodies of two hostages retrieved from Gaza

image.altText: Samples of rare earth minerals in vials

props.synopsis: A Melbourne small business finds itself unwittingly on the frontline of the trade stand-off between Donald Trump and Xi Jinping, as rare earths present an opportunity for Australia.

title.children: Rare earth magnet crisis creates an Australian opportunity

image.altText: A young man in a green vest puts his hand out to touch the nose of a big black animated dragon with green eyes

props.synopsis: How to Train Your Dragon is the latest movie to be picked up by the live-action remake trend. Using the same directors and some of the same characters, they've produced a faithful remake.Â

title.children: How to Train Your Dragon didn't need a live-action remake, but here it is

image.altText: Brian Wilson, Mike Love, Dennis Wilson, Carl Wilson, David Marks from band The Beach Boys pose with a surfboard

props.synopsis: His family released a statement confirming the news on Wednesday, US time.

title.children: Brian Wilson, co-creator of the Beach Boys, dies aged 82

image.altText: Tom Harley wearing glasses

props.synopsis: Two-time Geelong premiership captain Tom Harley leaves his post at the Swans to take up a role that is likely to see him leading the AFL one day.

title.children: Tom Harley appointed AFL chief operating officer

image.altText: Jarome Luai and Mitchell Moses embrace after the Blues won State of Origin III.

props.synopsis: Jarome Luai makes his NSW Blues return to replace the injured Mitch Moses after being overlooked for the State of Origin series opener.

title.children: Luai to replace Moses for Origin II after NSW playmaker's calf injury

image.altText: A beige building that says GRIFFITH UNIVERSITY on it. Blue sky behind.

props.synopsis: The university will repay millions of dollars to around 5,500 of its employees, with the largest of those individual repayments sitting around $90,000.

title.children: Griffith University to repay over $8m to thousands of underpaid employees

image.altText: A singer and fellow performers on stage at the Cabaret Fringe Festival

props.synopsis: The final curtain has come down on two Adelaide festivals, who say more needs to be done to support the second level of South Australia's entertainment calendar.

title.children: Money woes force Adelaide festivals to shut
